intro: Ardisia whitmorei, commonly known as the Malayan beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
